0: The food was mediocre at many of the restaurants on the property overpriced for what it was
I would recommend getting the room rate with breakfast
If you upgrade to the hot breakfast it is worth it
kids menus are limited kitchenette really added to our comfort with kids however there were no utensils or dishes there we had to ask for them
Did not eat at on premise restaurant instead went to downtown Old San Juan
No need to leave the hotel everything is there pool spa beach bar garden and much more
Eat at the restaurants in the hotel or area not room service
There is a Walmart 10 min away where you can pick up breakfast and lunch items to save a bit of money
1: it just reopened and is beautiful they have their own beach and pool with a swim up bar nice for family couples and singles beautiful resort
We also ate dinner there once it is like a NYC style food hall ie upscale food court with about 10 food options and a nice bar
Several pools include one for kids and a swim up bar
The food in the hotel is also pretty amazing I would recommend a restaurant
This buffet even has a chef who makes omelettes for you and staff who comes around and fills your glasses
Private beach huge swimming pool multiple restaurants and bars great spa
Bar tenders are amazing and the friendliest staff around and helpful
Mojitos restaurant definitely worth a try for any meals
Loved the polside bar and hammocks
restaurant choices were OK plus the Morton steak house on site which was very good but pricey as expected
